1.name: Catch-22
1.description: A man is trying desperately to be certified insane during World War II, so he can stop flying missions.

2.name: Myra Breckinridge
2.description: After undergoing gender reassignment surgery, an aspiring actress travels to Hollywood, where she also wants to make a claim on her wealthy uncle's estate.

3.name: MASH
3.description: The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war.

4.name: The AristoCats
4.description: With the help of a smooth talking tomcat, a family of Parisian felines set to inherit a fortune from their owner try to make it back home after a jealous butler kidnaps them and leaves them in the country.

5.name: Kelly's Heroes
5.description: A group of U.S. soldiers sneaks across enemy lines to get their hands on a secret stash of Nazi treasure.

6.name: Patton
6.description: The World War II phase of the career of the controversial American general, George S. Patton.

7.name: Love Story
7.description: A boy and a girl from different backgrounds fall in love regardless of their upbringing - and then tragedy strikes.

8.name: Five Easy Pieces
8.description: A dropout from upper-class America picks up work along the way on oil rigs when his life isn't spent in a squalid succession of bars, motels, and other points of interest.

9.name: El Topo
9.description: A mysterious black-clad gunfighter wanders a mystical Western landscape encountering multiple bizarre characters.

10.name: Rio Lobo
10.description: After the Civil War, Cord McNally searches for the traitor whose treachery caused the defeat of McNally's unit and the loss of a close friend.

11.name: Beyond the Valley of the Dolls
11.description: Three girls come to Hollywood to make it big, but find only sex, drugs and sleaze.

12.name: Tora! Tora! Tora!
12.description: In 1941, following months of economic embargo, Japan prepares to open its war against the United States with a preventive strike on the US naval base at Pearl Harbor.

13.name: Little Big Man
13.description: Jack Crabb, looking back from extreme old age, tells of his life being raised by Native Americans and fighting with General Custer.

14.name: There's a Girl in My Soup
14.description: TV personality Robert Danvers, an exceedingly vain rotter, seduces young women daily, never staying long with one. He meets his match in Marion, an American, 19, who's available but refuses...                See full summary »

15.name: Il conformista
15.description: A weak-willed Italian man becomes a fascist flunky who goes abroad to arrange the assassination of his old teacher, now a political dissident.

16.name: Airport
16.description: A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved.

17.name: Ryan's Daughter
17.description: Set in the wake of the 1916 Easter Rising, a married woman in a small Irish village has an affair with a troubled British officer.

18.name: Hercules in New York
18.description: Hercules (Schwarzenegger) is sent to Earth where he finds true love and starts a promising career in the bodybuilder business.

19.name: Lo chiamavano Trinità...
19.description: A lazy, unorthodox gunfighter and his portly, horse-thieving brother defend a Mormon settlement from a land-grabbing Major, a Mexican bandit, and their henchmen.

20.name: Two Mules for Sister Sara
20.description: Nun Sara is on the run in Mexico and is saved from cowboys by Hogan, who is preparing for a future mission to capture a French fort. The pair become good friends, but Sara never does tell him the true reason behind her being outlawed.

21.name: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
21.description: The sole survivor of an interplanetary rescue mission searches for the only survivor of the previous expedition. He discovers a planet ruled by apes and an underground city run by telepathic humans.

22.name: The Railway Children
22.description: After the enforced absence of their father, three children move with their mother to Yorkshire, where during their adventures they attempt to discover the reason for his disappearance.

23.name: Soldier Blue
23.description: After a cavalry patrol is ambushed by the Cheyenne, the two survivors, a soldier and a woman, must reach the safety of the nearest fort.

24.name: L'uccello dalle piume di cristallo
24.description: An American writer and his English girlfriend are stalked by a serial killer terrorizing Rome after the former witnesses a murder attempt on a woman's life.

25.name: Valerie a týden divu
25.description: Inspired by fairy-tales such as Alice in Wonderland and Little Red-Riding Hood, "Valerie and her Week of Wonders" is a surreal tale in which love, fear, sex and religion merge into one fantastic world.

26.name: The Vampire Lovers
26.description: Seductive vampire Carmilla Karnstein and her family target the beautiful and the rich in a remote area of late eighteenth-century Gemany.

27.name: The Boys in the Band
27.description: Tempers fray and true selves are revealed when a heterosexual is accidentally invited to a homosexual party.

28.name: Performance
28.description: A violent gangster seeks refuge from the mob in the Bohemian home of a former rock star.

29.name: Chisum
29.description: Cattle baron John Chisum joins forces with Billy the Kid and Pat Garrett to fight the Lincoln County land war.

30.name: Waterloo
30.description: Facing the decline of everything he has worked to obtain, conqueror Napoleon Bonaparte and his army confront the British at the Battle of Waterloo.

31.name: Zabriskie Point
31.description: At Zabriskie Point, United States' lowest point, two perfect strangers meet; an undergraduate dreamer and a young hippie student who start off an unrestrained romance, making love on the dusty terrain.

32.name: A Man Called Horse
32.description: In 1825, an English aristocrat is captured by Native Americans. He lives with them and begins to understand their way of life. Eventually, he is accepted as part of the tribe and aspires to become their leader.

33.name: All the Way Up
33.description: Fred Midway may be a bit short on brains but he's got plenty of ambition. However, before he can gain promotion as a salesman he must make his family more socially acceptable.

34.name: Hexen bis aufs Blut gequält
34.description: In 1700s Austria, a witch-hunter's apprentice has doubts about the righteousness of witch-hunting when he witnesses the brutality, the injustice, the falsehood, the torture and the arbitrary killing that go with the job.

35.name: Deep End
35.description: 15-year-old dropout Mike takes a job at Newford Baths, where inappropriate sexual behaviour abounds, and becomes obsessed with his coworker Susan.

36.name: Colossus: The Forbin Project
36.description: Thinking this will prevent war, the US government gives an impenetrable supercomputer total control over launching nuclear missiles. But what the computer does with the power is unimaginable to its creators.

37.name: Le cercle rouge
37.description: After leaving prison, master thief Corey crosses paths with a notorious escapee and an alcoholic former policeman. The trio proceed to plot an elaborate heist.

38.name: Getting Straight
38.description: A Vietnam vet and former social radical is conflicted by his desire to become a teacher and his sympathy with anti-establishment student protests.

39.name: En kärlekshistoria
39.description: Two teenagers fall in love over the summer, in spite of cynical and disapproving adults who dismiss their relationship as being nothing but young love.

40.name: Le genou de Claire
40.description: On lakeside summer holiday, a conflicted older man is dared to have a flirt with two beautiful teenage stepsisters despite his betrothal to a diplomat's daughter and the fact that the girls have boyfriends.

41.name: The Mind of Mr. Soames
41.description: A man who has been in a coma since infancy is awakened.

42.name: The Twelve Chairs
42.description: In 1920s Soviet Russia, a fallen aristocrat, a priest and a con artist search for a treasure of jewels hidden inside one of twelve dining chairs, lost during the revolution.

43.name: Indagine su un cittadino al di sopra di ogni sospetto
43.description: A chief of detectives, homicide section, kills his mistress and deliberately leaves clues to prove his own responsibility for the crime.

44.name: The Owl and the Pussycat
44.description: A stuffy author enters into an explosive relationship with his neighbor, a foul-mouthed, freewheeling prostitute.

45.name: The Ballad of Cable Hogue
45.description: A hobo accidentally stumbles onto a water spring, and creates a profitable way station in the middle of the desert.

46.name: The Landlord
46.description: At the age of twenty-nine, Elgar Enders "runs away" from home. This running away consists of buying a building in a black ghetto in the Park Slope section of Brooklyn. Initially his ...                See full summary »

47.name: Roxanna
47.description: The omnisexual nature of 19-year-old Roxanna is dragging her into a world of hedonism and sensual self-indulgence, only to realise that her sanity is at stake.

48.name: Husbands
48.description: After the death of a common friend, three married men leave their lives together, seeking pleasure and freedom and ultimately leaving for London.

49.name: The Out of Towners
49.description: An Ohio sales executive accepts a higher position within the company and travels to New York City with his wife for his job interview but things go wrong from the start.

50.name: Joe
50.description: Two men, Bill, a wealthy conservative, and Joe, a far-right factory worker, form a dangerous bond after Bill confesses to murdering his daughter's drug dealer boyfriend to Joe.
